name: Best Actor in a Leading Role
normalized_name: Best Performance by an Actor in a Leading Role

name: Best Actor in a Supporting Role
normalized_name: Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role

name: Best Actress in a Leading Role
normalized_name: Best Performance by an Actress in a Leading Role

candidates.notes: Judy Holliday was not present at the awards ceremony but watched it with several nominees in New York including fellow-best actress candidate Gloria Swanson. In Hollywood, Ethel Barrymore accepted on her behalf.

name: Best Actress in a Supporting Role
normalized_name: Best Performance by an Actress in a Supporting Role

name: Best Music, Original Song
normalized_name: Best Achievement in Music Written for Motion Pictures (Original Song)

name: Best Music, Scoring of a Dramatic or Comedy Picture
normalized_name: Best Music, Scoring of a Dramatic or Comedy Picture

name: Best Music, Scoring of a Musical Picture
normalized_name: Best Music, Original Musical or Comedy Score

candidates.notes: Originally Michael Blankfort had been listed for this nomination. Blankfort fronted for Maltz, who was a blacklisted writer at the time. Following research by the Writers Guild of America West in July 1991, the Academy officially attributed the nomination to Maltz and removed Blankford.
